title: Make a SORN (Statutory Off Road Notification)

details.description: Making a SORN (Statutory Off Road Notification) with the reference on your V5C registration certificate, V11 or V85/1
details.more_information:
Your vehicle must be in and remain in Great Britain to make a SORN.

% If you buy a vehicle that already has a SORN from its previous keeper, the SORN will finish as soon as you buy the vehicle. You will need to make a new SORN.%

##Penalties

If you don't make a SORN when you have to you'll automatically be fined £80, will need to get a new tax disc and must pay any tax arrears. You could also get a County Court Judgement against you, be fined a minimum of £1,000 and be liable to prosecution.


###If you're a motor trader

Motor traders don't need to make a SORN on a vehicle so long as **all** the following apply:

- it's only temporarily in your possession (until you sell it)
- it's being kept off the road (except to and from a licenced station for a pre-arranged MOT, vehicle identity check, or weight or emissions test)
- it's being taxed

You're a motor trader for SORN purposes if you're a: 

- motor dealer
- motor auctioneer
- vehicle dismantler
- vehicle insurer looking after a vehicle while a claim is being settled
- finance company licenced to temporarily hold a vehicle following an order for repossession


*[SORN]: Statutory Off Road Notification
details.introduction:
You can make a SORN (Statutory Off Road Notification) online if you are registered as the vehicle’s keeper. You’ll need the reference number on your V5C registration certificate, V11 or V85/1 reminder form.

**If you’re recently registered as the keeper or not yet registered you need to apply by post.**
details.alternate_methods:
##By phone

You can make a SORN by phone on **0300 123 4321**.

##By post

You can make a SORN by sending form V890 to DVLA. You can make a SORN up to 2 calendar months in advance by post, but if you are doing it this far in advance include a letter explaining why.

$A

DVLA  
Swansea  
SA99 1AR

$A

You **must** make a SORN by post if:

- you're recently registered as the vehicle's keeper and have received the V5C registration certificate in the current month
- you're not yet registered as the vehicle's keeper - in this case you can send your SORN application along with your registration application

$D

[Download 'Statutory Off Road Notification (SORN) - form V890' (PDF, 176KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065269.pdf "Download 'Statutory Off Road Notification (SORN) - form V890' (PDF, 176KB)"){:rel="external"}

$D

*[SORN]: Statutory Off Road Notification
*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
